result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luis Antonio Sandoval

defendant.name: Sandoval, Luis Antonio
defendant.address: 1145 S Oneida St, Green Bay, WI 54304

records.addlTxt:
C22-11797/22PT1660
Return of Officer
Application for Search Warrant
Search Warrant /s/ PB 10/28/22
Initial Appearance set for 11/21/22 @ 1:45 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess any firearms.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

1:02 PM Defendant Luis Antonio Sandoval appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Renc  appears on behalf of the defendant.

Court calls case.
Atty Cassidy states appearances.

Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of possession of THC/drug paraphernalia and felon in possession of firearm. 
Attorney for the defendant does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court recites the facts for the record. Court has jurisdiction.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Defendant   is not   eligible for public defender representation, but may change.
Defendant is on a probation hold. Atty Renc addresses the Court.

State requests a signature bond with conditions as stated. 

Attorney for the defendant does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
